snippet: The report found that disabled children were 3.6 times more likely to be physically assaulted and 2.9 times more likely to be sexually assaulted.
abstract: World Health Organization report in journal The Lancet finds that children with disabilities are 3.6 times more likely to be physically assaulted and 2.9 times more likely to be sexually assaulted than other children.
lead_paragraph: The report found that disabled children were 3.6 times more likely to be physically assaulted and 2.9 times more likely to be sexually assaulted.

headline.seo: Children With Disabilities Are Victimized More Often
headline.main: Assault: Children With Disabilities Are More Likely to Be Victims of Violence, Analysis Shows
headline.print_headline: Assault: Children With Disabilities Are More Likely To Be Victims of Violence, Analysis Shows
